data-definition.struct-type: -- If shot by a ranged weapon:

enum-item.name: wanderer
enum-item.comment: wandering the wilds/region/depths of the world (none/region/underground_region)

enum-item.name: refugee
enum-item.comment: into region only for dead. refugees and abucted-imprisoned-turned

enum-item.name: army_died
enum-item.comment: either no record of participation in battle, or character died and defender won (character on either side)

enum-item.name: army_survived
enum-item.comment: either no record of participation in battle, or character survived and defender won (character on either side)

enum-item.name: visitor
enum-item.comment: 'visited' as last movement seems to be the key

enum-item.name: no_statement
enum-item.comment: alive or dead, but death conditions not registered here

enum-item.name: region_battle
enum-item.comment: parameters: two unknown values, usually small, with same pair being the same region, but neither is region_id

enum-item.name: entombed
enum-item.comment: same parameters as for site_battle, but structure seems to always be present and be a tomb

enum-item.name: site
enum-item.comment: same parameters as for site_battle, old age and deadly confrontation seen

enum-item.name: Indirect_Director
enum-item.comment: Seen as 'possibly unknown director' in actor's exported XML when influencing the plotter using an intermediary in Legends Mode

enum-item.name: Director
enum-item.comment: Seen with no role or 'potential employer' in actor's exported XML, and as the one influencing the plotter in Legends Mode

struct-type.pointer: only a guess since most of figures have 102 (STANDARD); some have stuff like CLERK, SCOUT, BEAST_HUNTER, etc

stl-vector.name: events2
stl-vector.comment: ones that were stolen or destroyed?

int32_t.name: year
int32_t.comment: time of arrival at site/region_id, not time of death

stl-vector.name: known_secrets
stl-vector.comment: Interactions inflicted upon the figure through an I_SOURCE:SECRET means are recorded here; this appears to prevent the interaction from affecting the figure again on subsequent exposure (when rereading a necromancy slab, for example). For interactions with both I_SOURCE:SECRET and another source (I_SOURCE:INGESTION, for example), exposure to the interaction through the non-secret route does not result in the interaction being listed here.

int32_t.name: unk_10
int32_t.comment: All are gods with the DEATH sphere having created slabs, but the value isn't the id of the slab

stl-vector.name: known_written_contents
stl-vector.comment: ID of written_contents known to the historical figure. Aside from the contents of read books, these so-called written contents also include known derivations of poetic forms, dance forms and musical forms

stl-vector.name: known_identities
stl-vector.comment: identity ID of identities known to the historical figure, such as demon true names

stl-vector.name: unk_6
stl-vector.comment: same length as next vector. Some are definitely entities (e.g. player fortress or attacker site government), but others make no such sense

stl-vector.name: unk_7
stl-vector.comment: 5, 7, 8 seen. 7/8 only seen on humanoid experiments

uint32_t.name: research_points
uint32_t.comment: research is finished at 100k? amount gained depends on skills, attributes

uint32_t.name: times_pondered
uint32_t.comment: one per ponder no matter what. turns into research_points somewhere around 40-60.

pointer.name: belief_systems
pointer.comment: found in prophets; contains the ID of the belief system developed by that particular prophet

int32_t.name: unk_6
int32_t.comment: increases by 10 when eating in a location

int32_t.name: room_quality
int32_t.comment: 15 times the best dfhack_room_quality_level seen when using this room for an activity

int32_t.name: original_histfig_id
int32_t.comment: ID of the historical figure who was reanimated to produce undead historical figure

int32_t.name: original_race
int32_t.comment: race of the historical figure who was reanimated to produce undead historical figure

int32_t.name: original_caste
int32_t.comment: caste of the historical figure who was reanimated to produce undead historical figure

int32_t.name: root_body_part_id
int32_t.comment: ID of the root body part in the corpse or corpse piece which was reanimated to produce undead historical figure

stl-string.name: undead_name
stl-string.comment: display name of reanimated creatures in legends mode

stl-vector.name: deities
stl-vector.comment: When a divination die is rolled, the historical figure ID of the associated god is inserted here.

stl-vector.name: divination_sets
stl-vector.comment: When a divination die is rolled, the ID of the associated divination_set is inserted here.

stl-vector.name: roll_results
stl-vector.comment: When a divination die is rolled, the numerical roll result is inserted here.

stl-vector.name: year_rolled
stl-vector.comment: When a divination die is rolled, the cur_year value at the time of rolling is inserted here.

stl-vector.name: year_tick_rolled
stl-vector.comment: When a divination die is rolled, the cur_year_tick at the time of rolling is inserted here.

int32_t.name: fate_sealed
int32_t.comment: This is set to 1 when a divination die is rolled excessively in a given timespan, preventing all future divination die rolls from having an effect. Attempts at further divination will produce the following message instead: Your fate is sealed.

stl-vector.name: races
stl-vector.comment: contains IDs of races created by the historical figure through experimentation

pointer.name: books
pointer.comment: seems to be misnamed. Artifacts seen have been of all kinds

stl-vector.name: artifacts_held
stl-vector.comment: held as in possession, doesn't include stored

static-array.name: unk_3
static-array.comment: wildly varying contents. Probably unitialized, as at least some change when same save reloaded

pointer.name: reputation

pointer.compound: there's an unused dword here on 64-bit

pointer.stl-vector:
different from above - this might be wanted.unk
Constructor and save/load code handles the following 5 fields as if they were a compound, separate from the integer above

stl-vector.name: unk_1
stl-vector.pointer: guessing these are the same 5 fields as above, since they have the same version threshold

pointer.name: intrigues

stl-vector.name: potential_corrupt_skill
stl-vector.comment: only CONVERSATION, INTIMIDATION, and LYING seen; could easily be an entirely different type

stl-vector.name: potential_corrupt_unk4
stl-vector.comment: only -1 seen

int32_t.name: id
int32_t.comment: starts as index in parent vector

stl-vector.name: unk5_t14_1
stl-vector.comment: seems like sorted sequence of double digit numbers

int32_t.name: action
int32_t.comment: 8:prepare coup, 9:steal treasures and prepare coup. Bitmap?

int32_t.name: id
int32_t.comment: index into the parent vector (at least initially)

int32_t.name: unk9_6
int32_t.comment: site government seen. Target? Possible threat?

int32_t.name: unk9_10
int32_t.comment: site government seen. Target? Member of/possible threat?

stl-vector.name: unk11
stl-vector.comment: 4 bytes allocated observed, which cant' host a pointer

pointer.compound:
based on unk_4
this one has ANOTHER union inside it, sized at 11 32-bit integers and having 6 subtypes followed by another 3 integers

pointer.stl-vector: - this is the same 6-subtype 11-integer union seen immediately above in ptr_3

enum-type.comment: not a great name given that lovers, ex lovers, and lieutenants appear here, but histfig and unit are both used...

int32_t.name: family_head_id
int32_t.comment: When a unit is asked about their family in adventure mode, the historical figure corresponding to this ID is called the head of the family or ancestor.

pointer.name: vague_relationships
pointer.comment: Do not have to be available mutually, i.e. DF can display Legends relations forming for the other party that does not have an entry (plus time and other conditions not located)

enum-item.name: None
enum-item.comment: Seen on adventurer assuming an identity for reasons unknown

enum-item.name: HidingCurse
enum-item.comment: Inferred from Units.cpp after examining code using 'unk_4c'

enum-item.name: Impersonating
enum-item.comment: Seen where primeval creatures impersonate 'real' gods in modded game

enum-item.name: TrueName
enum-item.comment: E.g. of demonic overlords. Can be used by adventurers to gain sway over them

enum-item.name: InfiltrationIdentity
enum-item.comment: A guess. The cases seen all had the HFs fool the same entity that they were members of it, but no actual purpose was seen

enum-item.name: Identity
enum-item.comment: Claim a new official identity, seen when religious appointments are received

enum-type.comment: Some of these require at least one parameter of varying type. The text is what DF provides without parameter

int32_t.name: unk_34
int32_t.comment: passed to history_event::isRelatedToAgreementID, but all implementations of that function are broken currently

enum-item.name: hidden
enum-item.comment: event is hidden from legends mode when this is set

class-type.virtual-methods:
-- 10
-- 20
"In x, some event happened"
"the happening of some event"
-- 30

enum-item.name: QUIT
enum-item.comment: Give in to starvation as adventurer

int32_t.name: creator_unit_id
int32_t.comment: the unit who created the artifact

int32_t.name: creator_hfid
int32_t.comment: the figure who created the artifact

int32_t.name: unk_1
int32_t.comment: probably feature_layer_id, based on other events, but haven't seen non -1

int32_t.name: unk_1
int32_t.comment: probably subregion_id, based on other events, but haven't seen non -1

int32_t.name: unk_2
int32_t.comment: probably feature_layer_id, based on other events, but haven't seen non -1

flag-bit.name: bled_dry
flag-bit.comment: tribute was demanded, but not received

int32_t.name: stash_site
int32_t.comment: location to which the thief brought the loot

stl-vector.name: reasons
stl-vector.comment: 0 = ageless, 1 = murder

int32_t.name: building
int32_t.comment: Guess. the values seen are low numbers. Legends doesn't provide any additional info

int32_t.name: reason_id
int32_t.comment: the historical figure that the reason describes

int32_t.name: entity
int32_t.comment: the guild to which the figure belongs?

int32_t.name: acquisition_type
int32_t.comment: 0: purchased, 1: inherited, 2: rebuilt. Doesn't match. Seen purchased_unowned, inherited, and rebuilt_ruined together when value = 0

flag-bit.name: no_prison_available
flag-bit.comment: would have been imprisoned but for lack of accommodations

flag-bit.name: plot_surveillance
flag-bit.comment: due to ongoing surveillance as the plot unfolded

flag-bit.name: target_surveillance
flag-bit.comment: due to ongoing surveillance on the target

flag-bit.name: co_conspirator_surveillance
flag-bit.comment: due to ongoing surveillance on a coconspirator

stl-vector.name: unk_1
stl-vector.comment: when length 2 attacker/defender entity. When longer seems to contain unrelated civs at varying locations

stl-vector.name: unk_1
stl-vector.comment: These 5 vectors are the same length,0 or 1. Only 0 seen

stl-vector.name: unk_2
stl-vector.comment: 25, 25, 46 seen. All on the first few (oldest) collections.

stl-vector.name: unk_3
stl-vector.comment: only -1 seen

int32_t.name: unk_5
int32_t.comment: same as previous vector single element or zero. Sum?

stl-vector.name: ethics_unk1
stl-vector.comment: these three vectors are of the same length

stl-vector.name: ethics_unk3
stl-vector.comment: not seen other value

stl-vector.name: event_unk
stl-vector.comment: values 5 and 10 seen. These three vectors are the same length

stl-vector.name: negative_events
stl-vector.comment: Site dispute, war attack site, created site, and culled seen

stl-vector.name: event_severities
stl-vector.comment: Site dispute:-9/-10, war attack site:-2/-4/-5, created site: -20, culled: -20 (guess failed settlement)

stl-vector.name: attacker_role
stl-vector.comment: Tentatively 0: regular, 1/2 merc

stl-vector.name: defender_role
stl-vector.comment: same as for attacker role, i.e. 0-2, with 1/2 being mercs

stl-vector.name: noncombat_hf
stl-vector.comment: saw being beheaded, but that's only one checked

stl-vector.name: unk_3
stl-vector.comment: probably a boolean, as only 0/1 seen

stl-vector.name: unk_4
stl-vector.comment: probably a boolean, as only 0/1 seen

int8_t.name: unk_1
int8_t.comment: probably boolean. Only 0/1 seen. Looks like winner, with all '1' examined showing defeat of defender, from unscathed to death, and '0' showing no result at all or death of attacker

data-definition.class-type: most likely the same format as above

stl-vector.name: thieves
stl-vector.comment: all of the ones examined were mentioned stealing things during the same raid on the site

int32_t.name: percent
int32_t.comment: either percentage of single race or percentage of mundane

static-array.name: event
static-array.comment: not included in the main list

int32_t.name: next_element
int32_t.comment: 1024 for all vectors except the last one

int32_t.name: start_year
int32_t.comment: first year of the events contained in the element

int32_t.name: event
int32_t.comment: can be found in the relationship_events

data-definition.struct-type:
dtor 8532fa0
some value during worldgen, and at the end equals to the number of entities plus that value
unsure but 16-bit values make more sense than 32-bit
11 - necromancers

int32_t.name: event_id
int32_t.comment: NOTE: can be culled. Seen: failed_intrigue_corruption, event_agreement_formed, hfs_formed_intrigue_relationship

pointer.name: corruption
pointer.comment: Mutually exclusive with circumstance. Exactly one is present. Presumably 'bring into network' action doesn't provide membership

enum.name: target_relationship
enum.comment: set if and only if action = BringIntoNetwork

int32_t.name: target_relationship_entity_id
int32_t.comment: Only set when relation = CommonEntity. Common Religion/PerformanceTroupe/MerchantCompany/Guild seen.

int32_t.name: lurer_id
int32_t.comment: Can be set with action = CorruptInPlace, not otherwise
